ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] redundant entries in seed list
ygData.msgSnippet: Thanks Noah for clarifying my doubts! you are right. My crawler settings were not proper. From the host-report I can see that my crawler wandered to too many

Thanks Noah for clarifying my doubts!
you are right. My crawler settings we=
re not proper. From the host-report I can see that my crawler wandered to t=
oo many undesirable hosts.

Thanks again.,
Pranay
--- On Mon, 10/12/09, Noa=
h Levitt <nlevitt@...> wrote:

From: Noah Levitt <nlevitt@archive.o=
rg>
Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] redundant entries in seed list
To: archi=
ve-crawler@yahoogroups.com
Date: Monday, October 12, 2009, 3:28 PM






=
=A0




    
                  Hello Pranay,



Heritrix normally picks the=
 urls to crawl by following links. So it is only redundant to make xyz.com/=
a a seed if xyz.com links to xyz.com/a.



A url is normally only crawled o=
nce, even if it is discovered more than once. Unless your crawl ran with so=
me strange and unusual settings, your seeds do not explain why it might be =
larger than expected. Take a look at logs/crawl.log to see exactly what was=
 crawled.



Noah



Pranay Pandey wrote:

> I was wondering how heritrix h=
andles sort of repeated seeds.

> My seed list has the following entries:

=
> 

> xyz.com

> xyz.com/a

> xyz.com/b

> xyz.com/c

> xyz.com/c/d

> 

> =
To me, the first seed indirectly implies the remaining seeds. 

> Now, how =
is the heritrix designed to handle this? Will it be able to make out the du=
plicates in the very beginning when it reads the list and discards the rest=
? 

> Once, I ran my crawler with similar entries like cited above (making =
extra sure I get the MOST important contents in any case!) and noticed the =
crawl-data size to be considerably large! Did my crawler WARC'ed the same d=
ata repeatedly?

> 

> Thanks,

> Pranay

> 

> 


 

      

    
    
	
	=

le=3D"display: none;"> </span>

    <div id=3D"ygrp-text">
           =
       <p>Hello Pranay,<br>
<br>
Heritrix normally picks the urls to crawl =
by following links. So it is only redundant to make xyz.com/a a seed if xyz=
.com links to xyz.com/a.<br>
<br>
A url is normally only crawled once, even=
 if it is discovered more than once. Unless your crawl ran with some strang=
e and unusual settings, your seeds do not explain why it might be larger th=
an expected. Take a look at logs/crawl.log to see exactly what was crawled.=
<br>
<br>
Noah<br>
<br>
Pranay Pandey wrote:<br>
> I was wondering how h=
eritrix handles sort of repeated seeds.<br>
> My seed list has the follo=
wing entries:<br>
> <br>
> xyz.com<br>
> xyz.com/a<br>
> xyz.co=
m/b<br>
> xyz.com/c<br>
> xyz.com/c/d<br>
> <br>
> To me, the f=
irst seed indirectly implies the remaining seeds. <br>
> Now, how is the=
 heritrix designed to handle this? Will it be able to make out the duplicat=
es in the very beginning when it reads the list and discards the rest? <br>=

> Once, I ran my crawler with similar entries like cited above (making =
extra sure I get the MOST important contents in any case!) and noticed the =
crawl-data size to be considerably large! Did my crawler WARC'ed the same d=
ata repeatedly?<br>
> <br>
> Thanks,<br>
> Pranay<br>
> <br>
&g=
t; <br>
